Sentencas: Activating the O-2 molecule is at the heart of a variety of technological applications, most prominently in energy conversion schemes including solid oxide fuel cells, electrolysis, and catalysis.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: Perovskite oxides, both traditionally-used and novel formulations, are the prime candidates in established and emerging energy devices.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: This work shows that the as-cleaved and unmodified CaO-terminated (001) surface of Ca3Ru2O7, a Ruddlesden-Popper perovskite, supports a full monolayer of superoxide ions, O-2(-),when exposed to molecular O-2.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: The electrons for activating the molecule are transferred from the subsurface RuO2 layer.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: Theoretical calculations using both, density functional theory (DFT) and more accurate methods (RPA), predict the adsorption of O-2(-) with E-ads = 0.72 eV and provide a thorough analysis of the charge transfer.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: Non-contact atomic force microscopy (nc-AFM) and scanning tunnelling microscopy (STM) are used to resolve single molecules and confirm the predicted adsorption structures.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: Local contact potential difference (LCPD) and X-ray photoelectron spectroscopy (XPS) measurements on the full monolayer of O-2(-) confirm the negative charge state of the molecules.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface

Sentencas: The present study reports the rare case of an oxide surface without dopants, defects, or low-coordinated sites readily activating molecular O-2.
Titulo: A full monolayer of superoxide: oxygen activation on the unmodified Ca3Ru2O7(001) surface
